title: decent handwriting script
content:
Apparently it is essential that we have a 'handwritten' style font to use on a diary page for the mag I work for and at the moment we've got some awful piece of free rubbish that offends my eye. Can anyone recommend a half-decent, professional looking 'handwriting' font please?

It just needs to be something fairly informal and legible.

Thanks for your help,

G
author: G T

comments.content:
[Contemporary handwriting fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019132209/http:/fontfeed.com/archives/contemporary-handwriting-fonts/)

I personally adore [Olicana](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019132209/http:/new.typographica.org/2008/type_reviews/olicana/) by Nick Cooke.

Additionally have a look at these:

[Dolce & Dyna](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019132209/http:/new.typographica.org/2009/typeface-reviews/dolce-and-dyna/)  
 [Memoir](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019132209/http:/new.typographica.org/2009/typeface-reviews/memoir/)  
 [FF Mister K](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019132209/http:/fontfeed.com/archives/upcoming-fontfont-mister-k-pro/)

Thanks Rainer, I'm just about finishing a 'Fine' version at the moment.

Nick Cooke
Microsoft's Segoe Script is a good piece of work.

Nick Cooke wrote: _»I’m just about finishing a ’Fine’ version at the moment.«_  
Great news, thanks for the info.
